sentences.sentence: You may bring global temperatures back to pre-industrial levels, but the risk is that the poles will still be warmer than they should be and the tropics will be cooler than before industrialisation.
sentences.translation: 全球气温可能会回到工业化前的水平，但风险是两极的温度仍将高于正常水平，而热带地区的温度将比工业化前的要低。

sentences.sentence: The nineteenth century and industrialisation saw the downfall of the European silk industry.
sentences.translation: 19世纪和工业化见证了欧洲丝绸工业的衰落。

sentences.sentence: Perhaps with the tools of this new technological revolution, we will be able to undo some of the damage done to the natural world by the last one-industrialisation.
sentences.translation: 也许，有了这次新技术革命的工具，我们将能够消除上次工业化对大自然造成的一些损害。
